reviewText:
Quick Review: A relatively weak and uninspiring Endless Runner that gets boring as soon as the joke wears off (which is quick). At £4.79 or your regional equvilent this is an expensive game for the genre.

Longer-ish Review: Where's My Mommy?" is an endless runner that sees you mother get ejected out of your hosts poop hole and into the great beyond. Enter our protagonist a considerably small piece of fecal matter who must go on an endless runner quest to find her.

The game has 3 main mechanics; the ability to jump over obstacles
date:
the ability to go squishy to pass through gaps & permeable onstacles and the ability to go hard and break stuff like condoms.

While this all sounds like a silly fun laugh that is pretty much it. you amble through the levels basically trying to work out (and sometimes guess) which objects require you to go hard and which squishy. It is bizarre logic most of the time which is which and totally random others. Either way this mechanic definitely did not add to the game and I felt it would have worked much better just giving me things to jump over and dodge.

For fans of the genre there could be a fun 5 minutes here but for the price there really is better examples of the genre on the market.

For our initial first play of the game check our our video below: http://www.thegametutor.co.uk/videos/literal-first-play/160302_wheres-my-mommy-literal-first-play

A KEY FOR THE GAME WAS KINDLY PROVIDED BY THE DEVELOPER FOR REVIEW PURPOSES. MY THOUGHTS AND OPINIONS ARE MY OWN.

If you have enjoyed this review and found it informative please join our Curator group to get more recommendations http://steamcommunity.com/groups/gametutor#curation"

reviewText:
This game is absolutely disgusting. At the same time it's hilarious. The art style is fantastic, even though it's obviously parody-style. The music can be a little much, but it also feels like they're trying to make it funny, so that actually worked for me. The gameplay is super simplistic, I swear this game would sell more if I could play it on my smartphone. It's really DAMN hard though, you have to be really fast...I mean it's a runner game, you get exactly what you expect. Is it worth $6? No. Is it worth $3? Probably not. Get it on sale though, the game is well developed and a decent game to kill some time and/or rage at for a couple minutes before deciding to play something more involved.

And disclaimer...I haven't finished it yet. I can't even finish the second level, it's so ridiculously difficult.

This was my first look video. In terms of gameplay it doesn't change from this:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NPTqnI1-8n8

reviewText:
This game is full of $hit

EDIT:
Now joke a side, I can't recommend this game to everyone. Not because you actualy play with $hit that someone may find disgusting with everything you encounter on your way out, but because trust me when the Poopy start rollin' you will need Asian gene to complete the game. Yes it is challenging!

So if you are not in fast-paced runner games think twice before you buy this no matter how cute it looks

Graphic models and textures are OK! Sounds and music are OK! Nothing bad at it and nothing impressive.
Game runs great, I didn't encounter any glitches or bugs.
Price is fair with ammount of fun this game can provide.

Highly recommended to fans of 2D runner gamers.

reviewText:
I need to leave in 15 min. Gonna play this new game about running poop.

Sh*t, it's been 1.5 hours. DAMN YOU TAMPON.

More seriously, Where's my mommy is an independant endless rail runner (which is not my favorite kind of game) but the gameplay is simple to master yet fun, the ost is nice and the game is quite hard ( unlike a lot of its peers which are too easy IMO).
I think is the game is quite addictive and pleasant as you don't see the time pass.
Kind of reminded me of the time games were released because they were fun to watch and fun to play.


For 5.99€ or equivalent, this is a great buy : if you have a few coins to spare, and hours to kill, you should consider making it a place in your library.


10/Poop, would visit the colon of a mexican mule pornstar again.

reviewText: Where's My Mommy was maded by obvious fans of South Park and Binding of Isaac. Because I am also a fan of these games, I liked this game too. Game is simple time killer with good graphic and excellent sound sfx and music. Plot is simple you are poop who run through the anal tunnel trying to save mommy a gigantick poop, and you'll be surprised what people put into the ♥♥♥♥, these are obstacles that need to cross in order to beat your record. You can take one of two shapes for bypassing the obstacle diarrhea and tight ♥♥♥♥. Recommended to anyone who wants to be a little poop and run around the anal tunnel :)))

reviewText: This game is pretty nasty, but I'm sure that is exactly what the developers intended on. It isn't super deep, but I think for what it is it does a pretty good job and is pretty entertaining based on shock value alone (which isn't for everyone). If you are wondering if the game is worth a buy I would suggest watching some actual gameplay to get a feel for it. I did a let's play of it which I will link, but if you prefer less reactionary material and just want to see the gameplay golden giveaways has also done a non-commentary video of it. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6rOhQjjh99Y
